reviews.review_msg: I appreciated her as a professor, but she sometimes can be overly harsh when assigning activities based on the course readings syllabus. It can be a bit annoying and a lot of pressure. However, if you are well-prepared or interested, taking the HIST 204 course benefits from a quiz survey and some essential assignments ."

I had a great time in her class.  She was very interesting and passionate but she assigns a lot of work for one class.  While lecturing she likes to open up for discussion or ask the class questions, but gets a bit annoyed when someone doesn't answer the way she wanted them to

One of the worst professors I've ever had. Her marking scheme is completely inconsistent and ambiguous, and is entirely unapproachable. She is obviously passionate about history, but the way she presented it caused a lot of confusion and frustration throughout the class.

chenier is the craziest prof! shes wacky and funny. however, she is one tough marker! make sure you cover your ass good before you hand in your assigns. shes always questioning. but the course is very fun and interesting. make sure to know some aboriginal history first.

More challenging than hard. A hard marker but marks better when the quality of work was up to snuff. She's pretty funny, too. Demanding but offers different perspectives that make you think. Seminars important so reading is essential. Demanding but overall a good course.

lectures:unorganized,no clarity,no sequencing of events.Papers:hard maker,big on grammar,very biased view(her way or the highway).Not friendly,not helpful.Social history means ALL of Canada,not one class or gender.2nd year course but marks and teaches like 4th yr.DO NOT TAKE ANY COURSE WITH HER.

Very unorganized lectures, which makes it so hard to study for the final.  The lectures were cramed with information but she didn't really put much emphasis on anything in particular, meaning I have no clue what to study from.  And, she also likes to sing which she really SHOULD NOT do!

Very hard marker, very specific expectations. Unorganised lectures. Tutorials were scary...do your reading. Huge emphasis on women's and Chinese-Canadian history. Did not feel it live up to it's title. Not specific to what she wants on assignments or the final, and very LONG and tough final exam.

Lectures were packed full of information. Yes they were organized, but so much information. No Mid term on top of this means major studying for final. Hard to fine clear outline of what she really wants for papers and exam.
forget any canadian studies classes that you enjoyed... her's will ruin them for you. get out while you still can!

Very unorganized lecture style, often ran out of time at the end and rushed.  Hard to take notes for, ambiguous assignments.  Close-minded view on history, with bias towards womens issues and oral history.  If you don't agree with her, watch out - your mark will reflect it!  NOT recommended!!!

This rating is for HIST 200
Very accommodating regarding extensions, and provides good feedback. She is nice, but depending on the student she is talking to, she can be condescending which is very weird. She is a very hard marker, not a GPA booster class. Seems to find an issue with assignments every time, even if you do what she suggests.

There's not much else I can say about her. She is very good with granting extensions- in fact she provides them immediately on release of the assignment, with no penalties. If you're someone with ADHD or similar, I highly recommend.
Her lectures were engaging and I never left class without feeling like I'd learned something.
Course is poor design. Marking criteria is ambiguous. I would not recommend this course

Conflicted about my view towards this class. Tina is very nice/approachable and I found the course material interesting - but despite this interest and overall effort, I  shockingly ended up with the lowest mark I've ever gotten. Ended up with A's in my other 2 classes this sem even though I prioritized this one? Guess it just wasn't my class.

I took it in the fall and it was one of the best courses I've taken.  She is extremely helpful and personable.  You only have to read one or two articles each week. Lectures are easy to follow and listen to. The grading criteria is crystal clear and if you work hard, you will do well. I would take another class with her in a heartbeat!

In my fourth year and she is by far my favourite professor. She really cares about her students and is very responsive to student feedback. Despite it being Canadian history, her class is extremely interesting and she chooses very unique and engaging readings. She is crystal clear and eloquent in her explanations. Definitely take classes with her!

Really works to ensure that all voices are heard/respected in tutorial, and times her lectures well enough to allow for longer questions if they're needed. She seems flexible if you must miss a tutorial (I asked if I could write a response instead b/c of a family emergency). Get started on the book review early. Lots of reading there. Only buy one!
Best course I've ever taken.

He's a fun guy. One time we got to do our tutorial class outside in the grass. It's interesting for someone who is interested in the media and ways that people lived such as how important hockey is and inventions that were made, which amused me. He sings and plays guitar too. Overall, it was a fun class and the final was pretty easy for me.

I have had two courses with Seager and I agree with some of the posts about his in-class tangents, but I enjoy him and he is a really good person and is willing to help with any questions that arise.  Would recommend him.

Seager is by far one of the best profs I have encountered at SFU. He challenges students to think and treats those who do engage in class as equals. If you aren't into thinking critically about what you read, this isn't the class for you. Also be prepared for the occasional sing-along.

Very bad. take it only when you absolutely love history. History by i mean the most minor impact like the social impact of the comic Captain Canuck..or TVs. Deals very littel witht the real Canadian social issues such as racism, inequaliy, first nations and etc.

Has an interesting way of seeming a bit doddering but is EXTREMELY sharp. A bait and switch! Very aware of current culture, though clearly his passion is history. Very helpful when approached, very encouraging of discussion in tutorial. A little disorganized but is happy to give clarification when asked. Very enlightening class.

Professor Seager is really hard to understand in lecture. It is difficult to follow some of his tangents and the notes I took didn't seem to help for the exam. His anecdotes were interesting but often made it difficult to determine what to focus on from the course. Don't expect much, it's a Canadian history class.

Important to participate in tutorials as he will take note of who's who through this venue. The tutorials have little direction and are often irrelivant. One needs to make sure they take good notes in the lecture, participate in tutorial, and ask pointed questions to keep this compess-less captain on track and to ensure the relevance of info.

Assignments were unclear, and final was even worse. Wondered from topic to topic during lecture without any cohesion. Although his recall memory is impressive, his ability to teach is not. Wouldn't recommend, especially if History isn't your major.
Really nice guy.  If you're planning on majoring in History I would advise you to take a class with this guy.  Otherwise, I'd look elsewhere.
Yes I found him to be pretentious--but he does encourage those who excel and actually put effort into his classes.
Very Clear lecturer, its a shame b.c his attitude toward student achievement is very poor. Very imtimidating and unreasonable. In a second year class has a 20 page research paper!

Absolutley terrible proff. Acussed me of plagarism on first paper for not quoting enough.Went for help, told me to quote more. Second paper i quoted a bit more and accussed me and plagarism again saying the i wasnt using origional ideas.
You just need to finish the weekly discussions, write an essay (easy topic) and see him in office hour twice. Then, an easy A.

knowledgeable instructor who understands situation of students very well, so he never wants something from you more than enough, he's super flexible and then that makes you feel love the course as well. such a great experience with him definitely the best instructor ever
Best professor in FIC overall, he is inspiring, this course has lots of work to do, but he is always open to help you out through it. Gives reasonable grade with good feedbacks.
Best Professor!
Best teacher ever! very helpful and friendly!!
chill guy
